intro: Dioscorea oppositifolia var. dukhunensis, commonly known as the Indian arrowroot, is a tuberous perennial plant native to the Himalayan regions of India and Nepal. It belongs to the family Dioscoreaceae and is characterized by its starchy, edible tubers that are used in traditional cuisines. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has heart-shaped leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowering stems bear small, greenish-white flowers that develop into capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. This variety is valued not only for its nutritional content but also for its traditional medicinal uses in local communities.
